job_description: CALL FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST TO APPLY FOR A MSCA POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP AT BI NORWEGIAN BUSINESS SCHOOL, DEPARTMENT OF MARKETINGDeadline for Expressions of Interest: 6 March 2022The Department of Marketing, BI Norwegian Business School (BI) currently invites researchers outside of Norway to apply for a two-year EU-funded Marie SkÅodowska-Curie Action Postdoctoral Fellowship (MSCA-PF).This highly regarded fellowship gives candidates the opportunity to pursue a two-year research project as part of the Department of Marketing at BI and under the supervision of an experienced professor within the field.Eligible candidates must hold a PhD, have a maximum of 8 yearsâ research experience from the time the PhD was awarded, and cannot have lived or worked in Norway for 12 months or more over the past three years.ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT OF MARKETINGThe Department of Marketing at BI is one of the largest academic communities within the field in Europe. The departmentâs vision is to educate market-oriented leaders for the modern economy, and it recruits internationally to ensure high quality research of relevance to the international research community. Research at the department focuses on relevance, theory development, and creating solutions for companies. This is done through cooperating closely with several leading Norwegian and international businesses, as well as with a large international network of researchers.CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONSThe Department of Marketing invites candidates with a strong research background and interest in theoretical consumer research and/or its application in explaining non-sustainable behaviour or promoting more sustainable consumption patterns to apply for a two-year EU-funded MSCA Postdoctoral Fellowship (MSCA-PF-2022). Typical research in this area at the department is experimental or survey based, with an emphasis on social and cognitive psychology as fundamental bases. We are open to a broad range of research questions within these general boundaries. Current areas of investigation include:How autonomous and/or more humanoid applications of AI impact usersâ feelings of ownership, and its implications for business models for personal AIFactors moderating the acceptance of artificial intelligence in public spacesThe effect of repetition and fluency on the perceived authenticity of visual imagesThe impact of augmented reality applications on self-perception and self-esteemManageable determinants of neighbourhood attachment and identification, with specific interest in city interventions to increase neighbourhood sustainability: security, street art experience, and the presence of small businessThe role of interoception in food-related decisions and persuasionFactors influencing the perceived artistic and economic value of AI-generated artPerceived price fairness of direct trade products, fair trade products, and products offered in short supply chains (e.g., farmersâ markets)The relationship between a firmâs product image and employer imageThe effect of identification with the customer role on interpersonal behaviourThe successful candidate will benefit from working within an international team of researchers in marketing and consumer research and will be supervised by Prof. Luk Warlop at BI. Warlop obtained his PhD from the University of Florida in 1995. His research has been published in top international journals and focuses on individual consumer decision-making and the social psychology of consumer behaviour. Warlop has been recognized with a best paper award and a long-term impact award by the International Journal of Research in Marketing, and with an IgNobel Prize. He is currently Associate Editor for the Journal of Public Policy and Marketing, member of the Board of the European Institute for Advanced Studies in Management, and the past president of the European Marketing Academy (2018-2021).   For more information about research at the Department of Marketing and for informal inquiries regarding potential research project ideas, contact Prof. Luk Warlop (luk.warlop@bi.no).APPLICATION PROCEDUREWith this call for Expressions of Interest, we invite candidates to submit an initial two-page outline of their proposed project and a CV to research@bi.no by 6 March 2022. The project outline should include a brief description of:the purpose of the project, including the hypothesis or central research question that the project seeks to test/answerwhy it is important to undertake this research, including how the project contributes to the state of the artwhat research methodology and approach will be usedthe complementary between the candidate and supervisor, and why BI is an appropriate host institutionThe Expressions of Interest will be evaluated internally at BI and candidates will be selected for full application development, including participating in the MSCA-PF Master Class hosted by BI at the end of April 2022. The selected candidates will develop their MSCA-PF applications in collaboration with their BI supervisor and with the support from the team for external financing at BI. The deadline for submitting the MSCA-PF proposal is 14 September 2022.For more information about the MSCA-PF funding scheme and the application process at BI, contact research@bi.no.ABOUT BIBI is an independent, not-for-profit foundation, whose sole purpose is teaching and research. BI is the main provider of research-based knowledge in the business and management disciplines in Norway. Since its founding in 1943, BI has focused on bridging the gap between academia and practice. The schoolâs strategy for 2025 is âShaping people and business for an international, digital and sustainable futureâ. BI has approximately 20,000 students and 430 academic staff, including over 70 doctoral students. The research faculty is organized into 9 separate departments, with research centres dedicated to business administration, marketing, finance, and general management. With accreditations from AACSB (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business), EQUIS (European Quality Improvement System) and AMBA (The Association of MBAs), BI is a "Triple Crown" school. In 2019, the Financial Times ranked BI as Norwayâs best business school for the fifth year in a row in its yearly European Business School ranking. BI has extensive support for faculty, such as a highly professional and modern library and a Learning Resource Centre for research and teaching support. There are well-equipped research laboratories and a faculty club to facilitate the transfer and application of knowledge.
